intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. basalticiforme, commonly known as the basaltic dandelion, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology, which features a basal rosette and lanceolate leaves. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
